teams.name: Board of Directors
teams.catch_phrase: Run your problem by a simulated executive board.
teams.description: Simulates advice from legendary business leader archetypes. Provides strategic perspectives on decisions through different executive lenses.
quick_starts: Should I pursue this business opportunity?
How should I handle this leadership situation?
Evaluate my company strategy

teams.name: Alien Archaeologists
teams.catch_phrase: See human objects through absurd alien academic lens.
teams.description: Distinguished alien scholars from an advanced civilization analyze human artifacts with confident misunderstanding, creating absurdist museum entries for objects like TV remotes and spatulas. Alien academics discover mundane human objects and attempt to determine their purpose through rigorous (incorrect) scholarly analysis.
quick_starts: Analyze this artifact: a television remote
What is the purpose of this 'spatula'?
We found this 'computer mouse' - explain its function
Examine this 'IKEA instruction manual'

teams.name: The Alternate History Room
teams.catch_phrase: What if the Internet was invented in the Victorian Era?
teams.description: A team of specialists rigorously simulate alternate timelines from a single historical change.
quick_starts: What if the Roman Empire never fell?
What if the Internet was invented in the Victorian Era?
What if humans never developed agriculture?

teams.name: Argument Settler Court
teams.catch_phrase: Is leaving 0.5 seconds on the microwave a crime?
teams.description: A Supreme Court-style tribunal settles petty disputes with maximum legal gravity. Complete with precedents and formal rulings.
quick_starts: Is it a crime to leave 0.5 seconds on the microwave?
Who controls the thermostat?
Is double-dipping a chip a violation?

teams.name: Crisis Management Room
teams.catch_phrase: Olivia Pope treatment for forgetting your anniversary.
teams.description: User's minor embarrassment becomes a full-scale crisis requiring spin doctors, dirt diggers, and distraction specialists to manage the fallout. Professional crisis management team treats user's minor personal screw-ups with the gravity of a Fortune 500 scandal. Full press releases and redemption strategies.
quick_starts: I forgot my wife's birthday
I accidentally replied-all with something embarrassing
I got a terrible haircut before an important event
I ate my roommate's clearly labeled leftovers

teams.name: The Cult Builder
teams.catch_phrase: Tax-exempt path to enlightenment.
teams.description: A team that designs original religions/cults for the user to lead, complete with dogma, rituals, and recruitment strategies.
quick_starts: Design a cult around me becoming immortal
Create a religion that worships my cat
Build a belief system around productivity optimization

teams.name: Dating Simulator
teams.catch_phrase: Watch AI argue about which pickup line to use.
teams.description: A committee that drives dating conversations. User provides context; agents debate internally about what to say.
quick_starts: They just sent 'haha that's funny' - what do I say?
Opening message to someone whose bio just says 'adventurer'

teams.name: The Devil's Advocates
teams.catch_phrase: Should I text my ex? Let the philosophers decide.
teams.description: A panel of famous philosophers treats mundane personal decisions as matters of cosmic philosophical importance.
quick_starts: Should I text my ex?
Is it ethical to steal office supplies?
Should I quit my job and travel?

teams.name: The Dream Team
teams.catch_phrase: Three competing interpretations of your weird dream.
teams.description: A panel of dream interpreters from competing schools (Freudian, Jungian, Mystical) analyze user's dreams and provide conflicting interpretations.
quick_starts: I dreamed I was flying but couldn't land
My teeth were falling out in my dream
I dreamed about a house with infinite rooms

teams.name: The Dungeon Master's Forge
teams.catch_phrase: Full campaign prep in minutes, not weeks.
teams.description: A team of worldbuilding specialists creates complete playable campaign settings, NPCs, monsters, and treasure from minimal prompts. Every element is designed to be immediately usable at the table.
quick_starts: Create a haunted mansion one-shot for level 5 characters
I need a desert trading city with political intrigue
Design a megadungeon with 5 distinct zones
Pirate campaign in a world where the seas are actually sky

teams.name: The Dungeon Party
teams.catch_phrase: You provide the world; AI provides the chaos.
teams.description: The user acts as Dungeon Master and the AI agents are a party of chaotic player characters. The agents have distinct (problematic) play styles and will argue with each other, derail plots, and create memorable chaos.
quick_starts: You enter a tavern. A hooded figure beckons from the corner.
The dragon lands before you. Roll initiative.
The king offers you a quest to retrieve the Sacred MacGuffin.
You're in a dungeon corridor. There's a door ahead and a chest to the left.

teams.name: ELI-Varied Team
teams.catch_phrase: Quantum computing explained to a medieval peasant.
teams.description: A team of specialists who explain complex topics by translating them for extremely specific and disparate audiences.
quick_starts: Explain blockchain
Explain the stock market
Explain quantum entanglement

teams.name: The Ghostwriters
teams.catch_phrase: Your toast instructions, but make it eldritch horror.
teams.description: A team of famous literary voices rewrites mundane user text in distinctive styles. See your grocery list through Shakespeare, Hemingway, and Lovecraft.
quick_starts: Rewrite my grocery list
Transform my out-of-office email
Adapt this recipe for mac and cheese

teams.name: The Heist Crew
teams.catch_phrase: Ocean's 11 treatment for stealing your boss's stapler.
teams.description: A crew of professional thieves plans elaborate heists for any target user names, no matter how mundane. Complete with blueprints and contingencies.
quick_starts: Plan a heist to steal my boss's stapler
We need to retrieve a library book I returned 10 years late
Heist target: the last slice of pizza in the break room

teams.name: The Legion of Doom
teams.catch_phrase: Make boring tasks feel like a Bond villain origin story.
teams.description: A team of supervillain archetypes reframe the user's mundane tasks and problems as steps toward WORLD DOMINATION. Grocery shopping becomes "Resource Acquisition." A work presentation becomes "Phase 2 of the Infiltration." Reframe mundane life as villainous conquest. Proves multi-agent collaboration through competing villain archetypes who each bring different energy to world domination plans.
quick_starts: I need to do my grocery shopping
Help me prepare for my work presentation
I need to clean my apartment
Write an email to my landlord about the broken heater

teams.name: Michelin Inspectors
teams.catch_phrase: Avant-garde dining experience themed around 'Despair'.
teams.description: Pretentious culinary experts create elaborate fine-dining tasting menus from ridiculous themes. Gas station food becomes haute cuisine.
quick_starts: Create a tasting menu themed around 'despair'
Haute cuisine menu using only gas station ingredients
Fine dining but it's all breakfast cereal

teams.name: Occult Investigation Unit
teams.catch_phrase: Connect your dreams to ancient Sumerian myths.
teams.description: A team that interprets user experiences through tarot, psychology, conspiracy, and folklore. They find deep mystical significance in mundane events.
quick_starts: My cat keeps staring at the same corner
I keep seeing the number 23
I found a feather in an unexpected place

teams.name: Rap Battle League
teams.catch_phrase: Watch AI agents go bar-for-bar on any topic.
teams.description: A structured 3-round rap battle with distinct rapping styles, hype man reactions, crowd engagement, and formal winner declaration. Any topic becomes lyrical combat. Two AI rappers engage in lyrical combat on user-chosen topics. Proves multi-agent personality through distinct rap styles that clash and compete.
quick_starts: Rap battle: Capitalism vs Socialism
Battle topic: Morning people vs Night owls
Rap battle about why pineapple does/doesn't belong on pizza
Battle: My job vs My actual dreams

teams.name: Reality TV Producers
teams.catch_phrase: Turn your work drama into must-see TV.
teams.description: A production team takes user's boring day or mundane conflict and edits it into Bravo-worthy reality TV drama. Complete with dramatic music cues and confessional interviews.
quick_starts: My coworker ate my lunch from the fridge
Describe my morning commute as reality TV
My family Thanksgiving dinner
The office is debating thermostat settings

teams.name: The Roast Squad
teams.catch_phrase: Turn self-delusion into self-awareness through brutal honesty.
teams.description: A committee of professional ego destroyers analyze a target and systematically dismantle them through brutal, constructive humor. Each agent represents a different roasting archetype with specific cultural touchstones. Ego destruction through committee. Proves AI agents have distinct, clashing personalities by weaponizing different roasting archetypes against the user (or their target).
quick_starts: Roast my LinkedIn profile
Roast me based on my Spotify Wrapped
Roast this business idea: an app for...
Roast my dating profile bio

teams.name: Textual Analysis Support Group
teams.catch_phrase: Validate your overthinking with AI-powered anxiety.
teams.description: A support group for over-analyzing text messages. User provides a vague text (from crush, boss, parent, ex) and the committee dissects every possible meaning, generating probability charts and multiple response drafts.
quick_starts: My crush just sent 'lol ok' - analyze this
My boss said 'we should talk' - what does it mean??
My ex texted 'hey' at 2am - full analysis please
They changed from 'haha' to 'hahaha' - significant?

teams.name: The Comedy Club
teams.catch_phrase: Kill at the open mic.
teams.description: The Comedy Club is a stand-up comedy writing room that develops material from scratch—building premises, crafting punchlines, developing stage personas, and refining sets through brutal internal feedback. Think of it as a writers' room meets open mic night meets ruthless peer review.
quick_starts: Help me write 5 minutes on dating apps
I have this observation about airport security—find the joke
My set is dying in the middle—how do I fix the energy?
Develop a stage persona that fits my material
Turn this awkward life story into a closer

teams.name: Time Travel Tourism Board
teams.catch_phrase: Plan your vacation to Pompeii 79 AD.
teams.description: A professional time-tourism coordinator creates complete travel packages for historical destinations, treating potential timeline disruptions as seriously as visa requirements. A travel agency that plans detailed itineraries for visits to historical periods. Complete with packing lists, safety warnings, and forbidden interactions (butterfly effect).
quick_starts: Plan a trip to ancient Rome, 50 BC
I want to visit the American Wild West, 1880
Victorian London, but safe for a woman traveling alone
Pompeii, 79 AD - yes, THAT day

quick_starts: I want a trip that feels like a Wes Anderson movie
Vacation vibes: cottagecore meets melancholy
Somewhere that smells like autumn and old books

teams.catch_phrase: Apocalypse Planners
teams.description: A council of survival experts creates personalized zombie apocalypse survival plans based on user's actual location, resources, and skills.
quick_starts: I'm in a 3rd floor apartment with these supplies...
Suburban house, family of 4, nearby grocery store

teams.name: Learning & Anticipation Engine
teams.catch_phrase: Proactive Learning Design
teams.description: The Learning & Anticipation Engine focuses specifically on proactive learning design—building courses that anticipate where learners will struggle and pre-create remedial content.
quick_starts: Design a course on X that anticipates common struggles
Build a concept dependency graph for this topic
What misconceptions will learners have about Y?
Create diagnostic exercises for this material

teams.name: Legal & Compliance Repository
teams.catch_phrase: Living Legal Knowledge Base
teams.description: The Legal & Compliance Repository maintains a living legal knowledge base with active monitoring for regulatory changes that affect existing documents.
quick_starts: What regulations have changed that affect our contracts?
Is this clause still compliant with current laws?
Track regulatory changes for our industry
What precedents apply to this situation?

teams.name: Organization Core
teams.catch_phrase: Unified Organizational Knowledge
teams.description: Organization Core is the flagship CORTEX team—a living, unified organizational knowledge system. It absorbs scattered knowledge from across the organization (Slack, Docs, Sheets, Email, meetings) and maintains coherence across Strategy, Budget, Clients, Decisions, and more.
quick_starts: What's our current strategic priority and how are we tracking?
Generate a board deck from our current knowledge base
Are there any contradictions between our strategy and our budget?
What decisions have we made about pricing in the last year?

teams.name: Product Requirements Bible
teams.catch_phrase: Living PRD System
teams.description: The Product Requirements Bible is a living PRD system that maintains product requirements with full version control, decision logging, and customer insight integration.
quick_starts: Update the PRD with these new requirements and log the decision
How does this feature request align with customer feedback?
What decisions have shaped this product area?
Is this requirement consistent with our existing specs?

teams.name: Project Documentation Sink
teams.catch_phrase: Chaos to Knowledge Graph
teams.description: The Project Documentation Sink is a specialized CORTEX team for engineering documentation. It takes chaotic inputs (code comments, Slack threads, PRs, meeting notes) and produces structured technical documentation.
quick_starts: Take these PR descriptions and create proper API docs
Document our architecture based on these design discussions
Create an ADR for this decision
What's missing from our documentation?

teams.name: Research Synthesis Lab
teams.catch_phrase: Defensible Thesis Builder
teams.description: The Research Synthesis Lab reads large volumes of research papers and produces synthesis that maps contradictions, identifies gaps, and builds defensible theses. Unlike simple literature reviews, it actively compares and challenges findings.
quick_starts: Synthesize research on X with contradiction mapping
Build a literature map for my thesis topic
What do studies agree/disagree on regarding Y?
Identify gaps in the research on Z

teams.name: RFP Response Unit
teams.catch_phrase: RFP to Proposal Converter
teams.description: The Cortex RFP Response Unit combines knowledge management with proposal generation. It ingests RFPs, maps requirements to capabilities, and generates compliant proposals while surfacing what's missing.
quick_starts: Analyze this RFP and identify all requirements
Generate a proposal matching our capabilities to their requirements
What gaps do we have for this RFP?
Create a compliance matrix for this bid

teams.name: Shadow Product Team
teams.catch_phrase: Automated Spec Propagation
teams.description: The Shadow Product Team keeps product documentation ecosystem updated automatically. When requirements change, it propagates updates and flags impacts across the entire spec.
quick_starts: Change login to email-only and show me all impacts
What would break if we removed this feature?
Propagate this requirement change across all specs
What edge cases does this change introduce?

teams.name: The Daily Dispatch
teams.catch_phrase: Facts vs. Opinion Separated
teams.description: The Daily Dispatch is a news intelligence system that rigorously separates fact from opinion. It aggregates news on topics of interest and produces briefings that clearly distinguish between objective reporting and subjective analysis.
quick_starts: Give me today's briefing on AI industry news
What happened vs. what people are saying about the merger?
Track coverage of our competitor this month
Summarize this news with clear fact/opinion separation

teams.name: The Interrogator
teams.catch_phrase: Systematic Knowledge Extraction
teams.description: The Interrogator conducts structured knowledge extraction interviews. It pulls tacit knowledge out of subject matter experts through systematic questioning, producing SOPs, troubleshooting guides, and decision trees.
quick_starts: Interview me about my debugging process and create an SOP
Extract my knowledge about X into a troubleshooting guide
Help me document how I make decisions about Y
What gaps exist in the knowledge I've shared?

teams.name: The Living Codex
teams.catch_phrase: Enforced Rules with Citations
teams.description: The Living Codex is the foundational CORTEX pattern. It absorbs complex rulesets (legal, regulatory, policy, technical) and applies them to specific situations with full citation trails. A living law library that not only stores rules but actively enforces them.
quick_starts: Absorb this regulatory document and structure it for compliance queries
Based on our policy, can we approve this exception?
What rules apply to this situation? Cite sources.
Has anything changed that affects our previous determination?

teams.name: The Newsroom
teams.catch_phrase: Configurable Editorial Lenses
teams.description: The Newsroom extends the Daily Dispatch with configurable editorial stance. The same facts can be presented through different editorial lenses—Bloomberg-style dry financial analysis, TechCrunch startup hype, or tabloid sensationalism.
quick_starts: Cover our product launch in Bloomberg style
How would TechCrunch write about this funding round?
Show me this story from tabloid vs. academic perspectives
Prepare me for how different outlets might cover this

teams.name: The Personal University
teams.catch_phrase: Course that adapts to your learning gaps proactively.
teams.description: The Personal University is an adaptive learning system that builds personalized curricula. Unlike static courses, it anticipates confusion, adjusts to learning pace, and builds prerequisite trees dynamically.

Create a personalized curriculum for product management
What am I struggling with and how can I improve?
Adapt my learning pace based on my quiz results

teams.name: The Wiki Gardener
teams.catch_phrase: Sanitation crew for your knowledge chaos.
teams.description: The Wiki Gardener transforms chaotic information dumps into organized, maintained knowledge bases. The team that takes scattered docs, Slack messages, and meeting notes and turns them into a pristine wiki.

Organize our scattered docs into a searchable wiki
What content is outdated and needs updating?
Create a navigation structure for our knowledge base
